meta.name: description
meta.content: Atwater Elementary SD serves K-12th grade students and is located in Atwater, California.

div.p:
As a long-time educator, I understand how heartbreaking our announcement of continuing distance learning through the school year can be for our students and families. Please know our district is committed to providing ongoing education, resources and support for students, parents and staff. Please click here to see the full letter that was sent to parents on April 9, 2020.
</br>
Como educadora desde hace mucho tiempo, entiendo lo angustioso que puede ser para nuestros estudiantes y familias nuestro anuncio de continuar el aprendizaje a distancia durante el año escolar. Por favor tenga en cuenta que nuestro distrito está comprometido a proporcionar educación continua, recursos y apoyo para los estudiantes, padres y personal. Haga clic aquí para ver la carta completa que se envió a los padres el 9 de abril de 2020.

img.alt: Teacher Dave Ward with AVID Students
Dr. Sandra Schiber and AESD Students
AESD Student playing the Bass Guitar
Superintendent Dr. Sandra Schiber and Employee

div.div: To Provide a Learning Environment Where Students Develop the Skills Needed for Success.
CORE VALUES
We believe that students are the focus of public education.
We believe that each student is unique and that our staff and programs provide for multiple opportunities for success.
We believe in developing academically competent, confident and considerate citizens.
We believe that learning occurs best in a safe and respectful environment.
We believe our students’ success depends upon a highly qualified staff who are valued and respected for their diverse backgrounds.
We believe that we serve students best through programs and practices that are responsive to changing needs.
We believe that our success depends upon the development of effective leaders,
staff and students who create a vision and translate that vision into reality.

As a long-time educator, I understand how heartbreaking our announcement of continuing distance learning through the school year can be for our students and families. Please know our district is committed to providing ongoing education, resources and support for students, parents and staff. Please click here to see the full letter that was sent to parents on April 9, 2020.
Como educadora desde hace mucho tiempo, entiendo lo angustioso que puede ser para nuestros estudiantes y familias nuestro anuncio de continuar el aprendizaje a distancia durante el año escolar. Por favor tenga en cuenta que nuestro distrito está comprometido a proporcionar educación continua, recursos y apoyo para los estudiantes, padres y personal. Haga clic aquí para ver la carta completa que se envió a los padres el 9 de abril de 2020.

article.aria-label: Updated Food Services Information During School Closures - 4.13.20

h3.a: Updated Food Services Information During School Closures - 4.13.20

div.div:
Starting Monday, April 20th Monday: Meal Pick-up for Breakfast/Lunch for Monday/Tuesday Wednesday: Pick up for Breakfast/Lunch for Wednesday/Thursday/Friday Service will be available April 20th through June 5th (No Service on May 25th in recognition of Memorial Day) NO Enrollment Required, NO Cost! *Dates subject to change based on school calendar and closure* Until further guideline notice per Merced County Public Health
Lunes: Desayuno/almuerzo para lunes/martes Miércoles: Desayuno/almuerzo para miércoles/jueves/viernes El servicio estará disponible del 20 de abril al 5 de junio (no va a ver servicio mayo 25 por el reconocimiento de “Memorial Day” ¡NO se requiere inscripción, SIN costo! Los niños deben estar presente para recibir comida. * Fechas sujetas a cambios según el calendario escolar y el cierre * Hasta nuevo aviso por el Departamento de Salud del Condado de Merced

Dear Parents and Guardians, Merced County school district leaders have been working closely in monitoring the impact the COVID-19 health crisis has on our students and school community. The safety of students and staff continues to be a top priority during this unprecedented pandemic. As such, careful consideration has been given to how to best proceed for the remainder of the school year. Please click here to read the letter that contains updated information regarding school closures for Atwater Elementary School District for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.
Estimados Padres y Guardianes, Los líderes del distrito escolar del Condado de Merced han estado trabajando cercanamente para monitorear el impacto que la crisis de salud de COVID-19 tiene en nuestros estudiantes y la comunidad escolar. La seguridad de los estudiantes y el personal continua siendo una de las principales prioridades durante esta pandemia sin precedentes. Como tal, se ha considerado cuidadosamente la mejor manera de proceder durante el resto del año escolar. Haga clic aqui para leer la carta que contiene información actualizada sobre el cierre de escuelas del Distrito Escolar Elemental de Atwater para el resto del año escolar 2019-20.

article.aria-label: Check ParentSquare Regularly for District and School Updates

h3.a: Check ParentSquare Regularly for District and School Updates

div.div: This is a friendly reminder to check your ParentSquare app on a regular basis for updates from your child's teacher and/or principal. If you are not yet signed up for ParentSquare, you can download the free mobile app for Android or iOS and you can also use it from a computer at: www.parentsquare.com. Attached is a PDF version (English and Spanish) of instructions from the ParentSquare website. Este es un recordatorio para revisar su aplicación ParentSquare de manera regular para obtener actualizaciones del maestro y / o director de su hijo. Si aún no está registrado en ParentSquare, puede descargar la aplicación móvil gratuita para Android o iOS y también puede usarla desde una computadora en: www.parentsquare.com. Se adjunta una versión en PDF (inglés y español) de las instrucciones del sitio web ParentSquare.

article.aria-label: Now Hiring Substitute School Bus Operators

h3.a: Now Hiring Substitute School Bus Operators

div.div: Applications are being accepted in the Atwater Elementary School District Human Resources Office. You can also apply online at www.edjoin.org.

article.aria-label: AESD Recognized as Exemplary School District

h3.a: AESD Recognized as Exemplary School District

div.div: Atwater Elementary School District has been recognized by the state as an Exemplary School District. In addition, Elmer Wood has been recognized as a California Distinguished School. Both AESD and Elmer Wood were recognized for their efforts at a ceremony on Thursday, May 3, 2018.
A Tradition of Excellence

We believe that students are the focus of public education.
We believe that each student is unique and that our staff and programs provide for multiple opportunities for success.
We believe in developing academically competent, confident and considerate citizens.
We believe that learning occurs best in a safe and respectful environment.
We believe our students’ success depends upon a highly qualified staff who are valued and respected for their diverse backgrounds.
We believe that we serve students best through programs and practices that are responsive to changing needs.
We believe that our success depends upon the development of effective leaders,
staff and students who create a vision and translate that vision into reality.
A Tradition of Excellence
Time: 6:15 PM
Where: Atwater Elementary School District Board Room 1401 Broadway Avenue Atwater, CA 95301
Time: 6 PM – 7 PM
Where: Thomas Olaeta Elementary 2266 High Street Atwater, CA 95301
